column5: I seen this reply post by Bondar and got me to thinking.  http://www.cabelas.ca/product/73875/humminbird-helix-5-sonar  The finder is a nice price, but what does it cost to add  GPS  to a unit by the company? Is it really that much of a cost? Why not add GPS to all units.  Just curious to know this is all..

I would of thought there would of been a comment or two.  Would you not want  GPS with your finder and not have to over pay for one with it?  I sure a small chip cant be that much to add as a simple common feature.
I don't think it would cost too much.  But as long as people are buying the units without GPS they will probably keep making them.

and now people have 2 or 3 or more fishfinders on their boats  they don't need gps in each of them I personally like to use one  unit for sonar  and a different one for  gps/mapping..even-though the units I have have both on them

http://www.cabelas.ca/product/73878/humminbird-helix-5-sonargps-combo  Nice unit for the price.  I guess what I was getting at was, why not just make them all combos.Sure have one low end model, but the rest with GPS/SONOR.  Thanks for the post DW.

I bought a gps for my older humminbird for about 80 bucks a few years ago, not sure of the price now or if the same unit is still made, was a little white circle about as wide as a tennis ball. Sure made finding my lady o spots easier lol
